page.title: 12LIFE IN THE AREA
page.content: THE AREA LIES BETWEEN THE VILLAGES OF FISHLAKE AND SYKEHOUSE IN SOUTH YORKSHIRE AND CONTAINS THE HAMLETS OF FOSTERHOUSES AND WORMLEY HILL. TO THE EAST RUNS THE RIVER DON, TIDAL AT THIS REACH AND TO THE WEST A STRETCH OF THE NEW JUNCTION CANAL WHICH LINKS THE AIRE AND CALDER CANAL WITH THE SHEFFIELD AND SOUTH YORKSHIRE NAVIGATION CANAL. THE AREA IS EXCLUSIVLY FARMLAND, CONTAINING TWENTY SEVEN FARMS WITHIN ITS TWELVE SQUARE KILOMETRES. MUCH OF THE AREA IS GIVEN TO ROUGH GRAZING AND HAY ALTHOUGH CORN AND POTATOES ARE GROWN ON SOME ARABLE LAND AND TURF IS CUT FROM ONE SMALL SECTION. THERE ARE SEVERAL DAIRY FARMS AND SHEEP ARE TO BE FOUND IN THE ROUGH GRAZING FIELDS. OUR INTERVIEWS WITH LOCAL PEOPLE SHOWED THAT MOST CHOOSE TO LIVE HERE EITHER DUE TO THEIR WORK BEING HERE OR BECAUSE THEY ENJOY THE
